data.title: Citing an article or essay within a multi-author book?
data.meta_description: Zotero is a free, easy-to-use tool to help you collect, organize, annotate, cite, and share research.
data.text:
You would enter such items as “Book Section” and enter both the chapter and book titles, as well as both the authors and editors.

Thank you.

I was thinking one-click solutions using plugins, etc.

Now, in the way you just explained it, would I have to "start again" (that is, enter chapter and book titles and the authors and editors info) if I want to cite another chapter/section of the book?

The Zutilo plugin adds an option to the right click menu to streamline the process of making Book Section items from a Book item.

The general solution is to use the ISBN and convert to a book chapter, which requires minimal manual changes (adding title, chapter author and pages). A more specific solution that works for some publishers is using the DOI for a chapter if available, from the publisher's website (and if the publisher formats everything correctly, so it's actually less work than just converting from ISBN).
